full_text:
That explains a lot. I'm of the opinion that to truly "judge" this  
research fairly, you have to actively record.
The experience is what helps determine what is what and even listening  
to evp/itc is a learned talent and takes practice. Especially with  
harder to hear samples. Spirit voices aren't always human, and thus,  
don't alway sound like humans.

You just answered many questions and made things very clear - thank you.

Perhaps some day you'll join us in recording so you'll understand what  
we're talking about. Some things must be
experienced to be understood. I can describe to you riding a wild  
horse, but unless you've done it, you'll remain clueless to my  
experience. You'd probably understand a lot more if you simply make  
the effort to record.

Believe you me, if you sit quietly with nothing but a digital recorder  
and you record a voice out of nowhere that clearly says your name and  
more, I doubt you'll have to worry about matrixing or stray radio  
signals.

w.
